intro: Acilepis doichangensis, commonly known as the Doichang mountain bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and forested areas, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with a dense layer of fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
